channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre's memoir will be published months after her death
item.description: Virginia Giuffre was one of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's most outspoken accusers. Six months after her death, Giuffre's book detailing her...

item.title: Trump says National Guard is at the ready but hedges on Chicago plans
item.description: President Trump signed a series of executive orders doubling down on law enforcement, particularly related to Washington, D.C., but he equivocated on ...

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 22, including 5 journalists, in a Gaza hospital
item.description: Israeli forces killed 22 people, including five journalists, in two strikes on Gaza's Nasser Hospital, drawing global condemnation and prompting a rar...

item.title: Kennedy Center names new director of dance programming, days after former staff firings
item.description: Stephen Nakagawa, a former Washington Ballet dancer, will be the new director of dance programming. The announcement comes five days after the Kennedy...

item.title: The U.S. confirms its first human case of New World screwworm. What is it?
item.description: U.S. officials confirmed a case of the flesh-eating parasite in a person who traveled from El Salvador. Screwworm typically affects cattle in South Am...

item.title: Some FEMA staff call out Trump cuts in public letter of dissent
item.description: More than 180 current and former FEMA employees have published a letter warning of potential disaster due to cuts in the agency.

item.title: Lil Nas X pleads not guilty to four felony charges after LA arrest
item.description: The rapper, whose legal name is Montero Lamar Hill, was detained last week while wandering the streets in his underwear.

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia detained by ICE in Baltimore, faces deportation efforts
Grandma's craft store sees influx of customers after viral Facebook marketplace post
item.description: A grandma's quiet craft shop in Holdingford, Minnesota, got a big surprise thanks to her loving grandson and a viral Facebook post.

item.title: Cartel boss "El Mayo" Zambada Garcia pleads guilty to U.S. drug trafficking charges
item.description: Ex-Mexican cartel leader Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada Garcia pleaded guilty Monday to federal charges related to his role as a co-founder of the Sinaloa C...

item.title: Detroit Lions to induct Robert Porcher into Pride of the Lions
item.description: Porcher will be inducted into the Pride of the Lions during halftime of the team's homecoming game and home opener on Sept. 14.

item.title: French helicopter crew survive crash into lake
item.description: The helicopter was attempting to collect water to fight wildfires at the time of the crash.

item.title: Israeli double strike on Gaza hospital - what we know
item.description: Netanyahu said it was a "tragic mishap" but did little to address the apparent "double-tap" nature of the attack.

item.title: Mexico cartel leader 'El Mayo' enters guilty plea
item.description: Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada was arrested in July 2024, and is due to be sentenced in the coming months.

item.title: Five journalists among 20 killed in Israeli double strike on hospital
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said it was a "tragic mishap" and promised a "thorough investigation".

item.title: House Oversight Committee subpoenas Jeffrey Epstein's estate
item.description: House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer subpoenaed estate of Jeffrey Epstein, seeking over a dozen categories of documents.

item.title: Some National Guard units in Washington are now carrying firearms in escalation of Trump deployment
